title: Q2 - How do Consent Managers earn revenue if their role must remain neutral?
description: Under the Digital Personal Data Protection Act, 2023 (DPDPA), a Consent Manager acts as a neutral intermediary between individuals (Data Principals) and Data Fiduciaries. Its core responsibility is to facilitate, record, and manage consent in a transparent and interoperable manner â€” not to influence or monetise personal data directly.

previous.title: Q1 - Who oversees Consent Managers - is it only the Data Protection Board, or also the government?
